Can we please work on this too now: ## Ticket: Enable PWA "Add to Home Screen" Functionality

**Goal:** Allow users to add the web app to their iPhone home screen and run it without browser UI (standalone mode)

### Required Implementation:

1. **Create `manifest.json` in public directory:**
```json
{
  "name": "Your App Name",
  "short_name": "AppName",
  "start_url": "/",
  "display": "standalone",
  "background_color": "#ffffff",
  "theme_color": "#000000",
  "orientation": "portrait",
  "icons": [
    {
      "src": "/icon-192.png",
      "sizes": "192x192",
      "type": "image/png"
    },
    {
      "src": "/icon-512.png",
      "sizes": "512x512",
      "type": "image/png"
    }
  ]
}
```

2. **Add to `index.html` `<head>`:**
```html
<link rel="manifest" href="/manifest.json">
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes">
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style" content="black-translucent">
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-title" content="Your App">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/apple-touch-icon.png">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, maximum-scale=1, user-scalable=no, viewport-fit=cover">
```

3. **Add app icons:**
   - icon-192.png (192x192px)
   - icon-512.png (512x512px)
   - apple-touch-icon.png (180x180px)

4. **Handle safe areas in CSS:**
```css
.header {
  padding-top: env(safe-area-inset-top);
}
```

### Notes:
- HTTPS required for PWA functionality
- Users must manually add to home screen via Safari Share menu
- Test by deploying, then Share → Add to Home Screen in Safari
